problem_text:
A union A = Sα Vα of varieties of groups (in the lattice of varieties) is called irreducible if Sβ̸=α Vβ ̸= A for each index α. Is every variety an irreducible union of (finitely or infinitely many) varieties each of which cannot be decomposed into a union of two proper subvarieties?
A. Yu. Ol’shanski˘ı
